snippet: Wounds of Sri Lanka’s decades-long civil war that ended in 2009 are still widely apparent, and the Tamil minority is growing impatient with a recently elected government that vowed to hasten the postwar reconciliation process.
abstract: Jaffna Journal; Sri Lanka's Tamil minority grows impatient as post-civil war reconciliation process drags on; government promises to release detainees and give land back to families who were forced to flee have not been carried out and Tamil leaders fear they never will be.
lead_paragraph: Wounds of Sri Lanka’s decades-long civil war that ended in 2009 are still widely apparent, and the Tamil minority is growing impatient with a recently elected government that vowed to hasten the postwar reconciliation process.

headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka’s Tamil Minority Grows Impatient With Just Promises
headline.main: Sri Lanka’s Tamil Minority Grows Impatient With Just Promises
